      private Sequence findOverlap​(NTerm nTerm, Chromosome chromosomeEGDe)
      Find with which element on EGDe genome and RAST genome an NTerm overlap:
      region of 25bp at the beginning of EGDe gene region of 25bp at the beginning of EGDe RAST gene, if this overlap is smaller than with EGde take this one, in order to detect bona-fide aTIS region of 25bp at the beginning of Srna or ASrna of EGDe, if this overlap is smaller than with Srna take this one, in order to detect bona-fide aTIS overlap in the middle of EGDe gene overlap in the middle of EGDe RAST gene overlap in the middle of Srna or ASrna of EGDe

      The 25bp are given by aTISCutoff argument of the NTermFilter object

      Find if the NTerm start with a Methyonine
      if it corresponds to a regular start codon "ATG" we need a Formyl modificaition to prove its a real translation initiation
      If the methyonine corresponds to any other type of start codon, we don't need more to prove it's a translation initiation

      • applyCutOff

        public boolean applyCutOff​(java.lang.String cutoff,
                           NTerm nTerm,
                           Sequence overlapSequence,
                           int[] overlap)
        Read a cutoff
        Interprete each cutoff by returning true of false if the NTerm pass the condition
        If the cutoff contain an "or": parse it in two separate cutoff
        If the cutoff starts with an "!": return the opposite of the cutoff
        Parameters:
        cutoff -
        nTerm -
        overlapSequence -
        overlap -
        Returns:

      • isStart

        public static boolean isStart​(NTerm nTerm,
                              java.lang.String typeCodon)
        Find i an NTerm start with a methyonine (START), or if the amino acid just before the peptide is a Methyonine (START-1), or just after (START+1)
        Parameters:
        nTerm -
        typeCodon - START or START-1 or START+1 or nothing
        Returns:

      • isForMandAltStart

        public static boolean isForMandAltStart​(NTerm nTerm)
        Find if the NTerm start with a Methyonine
        if it corresponds to a regular start codon "ATG" we need a Formyl modificaition to prove its a real translation initiation
        If the methyonine corresponds to any other type of start codon, we don't need more to prove it's a translation initiation
        Parameters:
        nTerm -
        Returns:

      • findOverlap

        private Sequence findOverlap​(NTerm nTerm,
                             Chromosome chromosomeEGDe)
        Find with which element on EGDe genome and RAST genome an NTerm overlap:
      • region of 25bp at the beginning of EGDe gene
      • region of 25bp at the beginning of EGDe RAST gene, if this overlap is smaller than with EGde take this one, in order to detect bona-fide aTIS
      • region of 25bp at the beginning of Srna or ASrna of EGDe, if this overlap is smaller than with Srna take this one, in order to detect bona-fide aTIS
      • overlap in the middle of EGDe gene
      • overlap in the middle of EGDe RAST gene
      • overlap in the middle of Srna or ASrna of EGDe

        The 25bp are given by aTISCutoff argument of the NTermFilter object
Parameters:
nTerm -
genome -
genomeRAST -
Returns:
